medical_history.chief_complaint: Sudden onset RLQ and periumbilical abdominal pain.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient presents with a 3-day history of sudden onset right lower quadrant and periumbilical abdominal pain, increasing in severity. Symptoms include nausea and several episodes of non-bloody, non-bilious emesis. Anorexia has been noted since the pain began. She also experiences myalgias and chills, and was febrile to 101.4Â°F at home earlier today. She has not eaten anything since yesterday except a few candies, and her last bowel movement was this morning.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Uterine cancer s/p chemoradiation and hysterectomy, bladder cancer s/p polyp removal, chronic right lower extremity lymphedema.
medical_history.family_history: History of colon cancer in two brothers, uterine cancer in a sister, and renal cancer in a sister.
